metadata.title: CVE-2020-35492 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in cairo's image-compositor.c in all versions prior to1.17.4. This flaw allows an attacker who can provide a crafted input fileto cairo's image-compositor (for example, by convincing a user to open afile in an application using cairo, or if an application uses cairo onuntrusted input) to cause a stack buffer overflow -> out-of-bounds WRITE.The highest impact from this vulnerability is to confidentiality,integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cairo-perf-utils - 1.16.0-5ubuntu2
libcairo-gobject2 - 1.16.0-5ubuntu2
libcairo-script-interpreter2 - 1.16.0-5ubuntu2
libcairo2 - 1.16.0-5ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cairo package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.0-5ubuntu2').
